title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Transforming Healthcare Document Processing Workflows with Generative AI

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this technical session demonstrates AWS's GenAI Intelligent Document Processing (GenAIIDP), which combines Amazon Textract and Bedrock to convert days-long manual healthcare document workflows into minutes through automated classification, data extraction, and criteria validation. The session includes live demonstrations and architecture deep-dives on scalable pipelines, integration patterns, HIPAA compliance, and best practices for optimizing ROI.
bullets: GenAIIDP combines Amazon Textract and Bedrock for document processing
Automates classification, data extraction, and criteria validation
Transforms processing times from days to minutes
Maintains HIPAA compliance
Includes live demos and architecture deep-dives on scalability, integration, and ROI
takeaways: Plan for scalable document-processing pipelines to handle increased throughput and GenAI workloads
Evaluate integration patterns to connect GenAIIDP with existing healthcare systems and workflows
Ensure HIPAA-related controls and compliance requirements are met in the pipeline design
Anticipate significant reductions in manual processing time and opportunities to optimize ROI
Account for supporting Amazon Textract and Bedrock as core components of the solution

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description… TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy GenAI solutions, leveraging Google Cloud's infrastructure to streamline operations and increase developer productivity. The collaboration compressed TTEC's digital transformation timeline and unlocked entirely new revenue streams while expanding what the company saw as possible for its business.
bullets: TTEC worked with Google Cloud Consulting to accelerate AI solution prototyping and deployment.
GenAI and Google Cloud infrastructure were used to streamline operations and boost developer productivity.
The partnership enabled faster digital transformation and expanded business ambitions.
New AI-driven capabilities unlocked entirely new revenue streams for TTEC.
takeaways: Cloud-native infrastructure can speed AI deployment and shorten transformation timelines—consider consulting to accelerate rollout.
Leveraging GenAI on robust cloud platforms can improve developer productivity, reducing time-to-market for new services.
AI deployments can create new revenue opportunities, so evaluate cloud investments for business-model expansion.
Partnering with experienced cloud consultants can compress project timelines and broaden what’s achievable with existing teams.

takeaways: Use this recording as the primary source for the Fed's post-meeting statements and messaging

Bookmark or review the full conference for any official language that could affect financing or risk assessments
Monitor WSJ's coverage of the conference for timely access to the full video

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this episode addresses how finance teams can strengthen collaboration with audit committees during the year-end accounting and reporting cycle. It covers practical communication and reporting strategies and focuses on emerging oversight areas including AI, enterprise risk management, cyber risk in the age of AI, transformation initiatives, and proxy disclosures.
bullets: Strengthening management–audit committee communication and collaboration for a packed year‑end agenda.
Key year‑end accounting and reporting issues finance teams should be ready to address.
Oversight of AI: identifying risks, opportunities, and appropriate controls.
Enhancing enterprise risk oversight and governance of transformation initiatives.
Evolving cyber risk considerations tied to AI and elevating proxy disclosures.
takeaways: Align finance and audit committees early on year‑end priorities and transformation initiatives to avoid surprises and streamline reporting.
Be prepared to discuss specific year‑end accounting issues and their governance implications with those charged with oversight.
Establish clear AI governance, risk assessments, and control frameworks to support audit committee oversight of AI-driven systems.
Prioritize cyber risk controls and incident‑response planning that consider AI‑related threat vectors.
Ensure disclosures (including proxy materials) reflect evolving risks, oversight responsibilities, and governance practices.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video follows Jo discovering the power of Copilot Groups and how they make route planning easier. It highlights Microsoft Copilot as a tool for simplifying route planning tasks.
bullets: Focus on Copilot Groups as a route-planning aid
Highlights ease of route planning
Central character: Jo discovering the feature
Branded Microsoft Copilot content
Includes hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai
takeaways: If route planning is part of operations, tools that simplify it (like Copilot Groups) may be worth evaluating for field crew logistics
Consider a pilot evaluation of Copilot Groups to see if they streamline dispatching and routing workflows
Check integration and compatibility with existing operational and scheduling systems before adoption
Measure potential time and coordination savings in controlled tests before wider rollout

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG ON AIR features Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska discussing practical AI use in audit, including tools such as an AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI conversational assistants and the KPMG Clara platform. They outline how AI enables full-population analyses, real-time audit management and improved client communication, and they address changing auditor roles, needed competencies, implementation challenges, data security/regulatory issues and potential risks.
bullets: AI Transaction Scoring Tool enables analysis of full populations rather than sampling.
Clara AI provides conversational assistance and specialized agents to support auditors.
AI supports documentation and analysis of disclosures, improving efficiency.
KPMG Clara platform manages audits in real time; Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
Discussion covers shifting auditor roles, implementation challenges, data security/regulation and potential AI risks.
takeaways: Expect greater demand for secure, auditable data pipelines as audits move from sampling to full-population analysis.
Real-time audit platforms will require integration with operational systems and timely data access.
Invest in staff upskilling and cross-functional competencies (audit + data/AI) to work effectively with AI tools.
Strengthen data security, governance and regulatory-compliance controls before adopting AI-driven audit processes.
Assess and plan for AI-related operational and governance risks as part of audit technology rollouts.
